pr_title: Use specific name prefix in preemptive timeout threads

timeline.bodyText: There's no need to do this, Thread already does this if no group is specified explicitly.
timeline.author: marcphilipp

replies.bodyText: I think it makes sense if the factory is about to create many threads but given that at the moment we have a factory per thread it can be removed.
replies.author: zabetak

timeline.bodyText: I don't think we need these two ifs as we shut down the executor afterwards.
timeline.author: marcphilipp

replies.bodyText:
I don't think it matters if we shutdown the executor or not. Even after shutdown the thread is not guaranteed to terminate so being a daemon or not matters.
Moreover, in a setting where there many threads competing for CPU if these ones have low/high priority it might have an impact.
replies.author: zabetak

replies.bodyText:
Even after shutdown the thread is not guaranteed to terminate so being a daemon or not matters.

Do you mean we should make it a daemon thread to avoid it from preventing the VM to shut down?
replies.author: marcphilipp

replies.bodyText: Basically, I am saying that we should decide if we want daemon or non daemon threads. If we don't specify it then we rely on the status of the parent thread. In this case, I could prefer non-daemon threads.
replies.author: zabetak

timeline.message:
Use specific name prefix in preemptive timeout threads

Having a specific name prefix is useful when debugging stack traces to
quickly identify which threads are created by the junit framework and
from where exactly.

Remove ThreadGroup resolution from the constructor of the thread factory

The same resolution takes place inside the constructor of Thread class
if group is null.
Let timeout thread inherit daemon status and priority from parent
Increase timeout in test to avoid flakiness in slow machines
Remove explicit group and stacksize from the Thread constructor
